byline.original: By C.L. SCLZBERGER By Telephone to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Greeks take Pogradec; Argyrokastron sector battle continues; Greeks drive on Ostrovitza and Porto Edda; map; Greek planes bomb Delvino, Elbasan, Durazzo and Valona; sinking of Ital submarine by Greek destroyer Aetos Nov 21 announced; Ital planes bomb Greek villages and troops
snippet: ATHENS, Nov. 30--The Greek Army captured the important Albanian town of Pogradec today in what is regarded as the second most important victory of the war, being overshadowed only by the previous conquest of Koritza....

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICA AND NEAR EAST AREAS

headline.main: PUSH ON IN ALBANIA; Gains in Argyrokastron Battle Are Reported-- Fliers Raid Ports GREEKS SINK SUBMARINE Italians to Wage War Without Nazi Aid--Crack New Army Is Rushed to the Front

lead_paragraph: ATHENS, Nov. 30--The Greek Army captured the important Albanian town of Pogradec today in what is regarded as the second most important victory of the war, being overshadowed only by the previous conquest of Koritza.
